content.body: So has anyone else ever needed a `String.codePointCompare` function (a la `Intl.Collator.prototype.compare`) to use with `sort` for comparing strings by Unicode code points instead of the default code units (when the comparator is missing). It seems that there is no Intl locale / collation that will do a dumb code point compare.
